title: Book of Esther
subtitle: Courage in the Quiet
summary: Ten contemplative readings that uncover God’s hidden work in seasons of uncertainty and waiting.

days.title: A hidden arrival
days.summary: Meet Esther and Mordecai in exile and notice how they carry quiet faith in a foreign land.

readings.focus: Vashti’s refusal and the opening tension
readings.note: The book never mentions God directly, inviting you to look for His providence between the lines.

prompts.question: Where do you feel unseen or out of place right now?
How might God already be preparing a way forward?

reflection: How does Esther’s situation mirror places you feel powerless?
Pray for courage to stay faithful in hidden seasons.

days.title: Chosen for a purpose
days.summary: Watch Esther’s rise to the throne and consider how God positions people for His timing.

readings.note: Esther’s Hebrew name Hadassah hints at her roots even as she lives in Persia.

prompts.question: Where have you found unexpected favor?
What gifts or positions has God entrusted to you for others’ good?

reflection: Write about a time God used an ordinary step to open a door.
Pray over the influence you hold today, however small it seems.

days.title: A plot uncovered
days.summary: Explore Mordecai’s loyalty and the seeds of conflict with Haman.

readings.note: Notice how refusal to bow becomes a matter of worship and identity.

prompts.question: Where is God inviting you to stand firm without bitterness?
How do you respond when obedience has relational cost?

reflection: What fears surface when you imagine taking a costly stand?
Ask God for humility and resolve.

days.title: For such a time
days.summary: Hear Mordecai’s appeal and Esther’s brave decision to risk approaching the king.

readings.note: Community fasting surrounds Esther’s decision; notice the shared dependence on God.

prompts.question: What decision before you needs communal prayer?
How does fasting sharpen Esther’s courage?

reflection: Name where God might have placed you “for such a time as this.”
Pray for boldness coupled with humility.

days.title: The turning point
days.summary: Join Esther’s first feast and watch tension build before the reversal.

readings.note: The suspense heightens as Esther moves slowly and wisely.

prompts.question: How do patience and strategy serve courage?
Where might pride be blinding in your own life?

reflection: Invite God to refine your motives when you take risks.
List the people who pray with you as you step forward.
